intro: Hiraea guapecita, commonly known as the Guianan hiraea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy surface. Its flowering period occurs during the wet season, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
